recipe_name: Sea bass with walnut, mint and feta pesto
author: Mitch Tonks
method: Season the sea bass fillet and place, skin side down, in a hot ovenproof pan. Transfer to a hot oven and cook for three minutes. Meanwhile, make the pesto.  Toast the walnuts in a dry pan. Put all the ingredients, except the olive oil, into a pestle and mortar. Pound thoroughly until you have a chunky paste. Gradually add the olive oil to give the sauce a drizzling consistency. Season to taste, and serve the sea bass fillet with the sauce.
